item.description: Hello! Hallo! 你好！ I’m a second year graduate student in Graduate Group of Biostatistics, at University of California, Berkeley, working in Prof. Yun S. Song’s group. I am broadly interested in statistical machine learning, causal inference and transfer learning, with applications in scRNA-seq and microbiome. Feel free to contact me: ytwang at berkeley dot edu

item.title: Education
item.description: Graduate Coursework: Robust Statistics in High Dimensions, Theoretical Statistics, Advanced topics in Causal Inference, Probabilistic Modeling in Genomics, Statistical Models: Theory and Application I, II, Computational Statistics with Applications in Biology and Medicine Undergraduate Coursework: Functional Analysis, PDE, ODE, Real Analysis, Complex Analysis, Abstract Algebra, Stochastic Process, Probability, Mathematical Statistics, Statistical Inference, Optimization Methods, Modern Data Mining, Data Analytics & Statistical Computing, Computer Methods with Mathematical Science, C++, Advanced Calculus, Advanced Algebra, Analytical Geometry

item.title: Misc
item.description: I used to work as a volunteer journalist in the New Citizen Program in China to raise the sexual health awareness of the public, left-behind children in particular. I later realized credible statistics of domestic sexual crime is impossibly difficult to collect in my home country. Thus I’ve been consistently interested in data collection and statistical analysis of related social issues for the sake of public policy-making. I have published several articles in Chinese as a journalist, Here are some excerpts from my previous work.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Fall 2018 - Spring 2019: Introduction to Statistics (Stat 2), with Professor Cari Kaufman
